articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 28 people were killed when an airliner went off the runway and slammed into a wall at South Korea's Muan International Airport on Sunday, Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: At least 28 dead in fiery aircraft crash in South Korea, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Cynthia Kim
articles.description: When South Korea's acting President Choi Sang-mok arrived at the scene of the deadliest air disaster on the country's soil on Sunday, he had been on the job for less than 48 hours.
articles.title: Air crash tests South Korea's acting president two days into the job

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces carrying out a weeks-long offensive in northern Gaza ordered any residents remaining in Beit Hanoun to quit the town on Sunday, pointing to Palestinian militant rocket fire from the area, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli forces order new evacuation at besieged northern Gaza town, residents say

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Hostages held in Gaza were subjected to torture, including sexual and psychological abuse, starvation, burns and medical neglect, according to a new report by the Israeli Health Ministry that will be submitted to the United Nations this week.
articles.title: Gaza captors tortured hostages, including minors, Israeli report says

articles.author: Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Azerbaijan on Sunday paid tribute to the pilots and passengers of the Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane that crashed in Kazakhstan killing 38 people after Russian air defences were used against Ukrainian drones.
articles.title: Azerbaijan pays tribute to pilots and passengers who perished in air crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polling stations across Croatia opened at 0600 GMT on Sunday to elect the country's new president, a mainly ceremonial office, in a race where candidates from the two biggest parties are the main contenders.
articles.title: Croats vote to elect new president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Holding elections in Syria could take up to four years, Syria's de facto leader Ahmed al-Sharaa said in an interview with Al Arabiya on Sunday, the first time he has commented on a possible timetable for elections since Bashar al-Assad was ousted this month.
articles.title: Syria's de facto leader says holding elections could take up to four years

articles.author: Anton Kolodyazhnyy, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia will scrap a moratorium on the deployment of intermediate and shorter range nuclear-capable missiles because the United States has deployed such weapons in various regions around the world, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia will abandon its unilateral missile moratorium, Lavrov says

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un held a key policy-setting meeting of the country's ruling party last week ahead of the new year, state media KCNA reported on Sunday.
articles.title: North Korea launches 'toughest' U.S. strategy in key party meeting

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday sided with key supporter and billionaire tech CEO Elon Musk in a public dispute over the use of the H-1B visa, saying he fully backs the program for foreign tech workers opposed by some of his supporters.
articles.title: Trump sides with Elon Musk in H-1B visa debate, says he's always been in favor of the program
